name: QUAKE Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon
description: After defeating Shub-Niggurath, you arrive back at your home base on Earth, but it's not all blue skies and butterflies. Apparently, not all QUAKE forces have been subdued. Chaos ensues as you blast your way through the QUAKE minions and toward the infested gateway. Your only choice is to find the source of evil and shut it down.

reviews.review_text: A really good episode of this awesome series. New monsters, weapons, stages, story... This brings QUAKE to a better level, but as the first QUAKE, this is a short game.  9/10

A great continuation from the first game. This mission pack offers more story, new gameplay elements, new bosses and of course more classic Quake action. I very much enjoyed playing through this decent lengthed mission pack. This game should have been the ending of Quake 1 it concludes better than Quake does.
Probably one of the best add-ons for Q1. Atmospheric level design + some new features. Need to buy, need to play.

After completing the original QUAKE, you may think you're the biggest bad-♥♥♥ this side of QUAKE-con. But after you play the first level of Scourge of Armagon, you realise you're wrong. You're actually just getting started.  This mission pack is lengthy and difficult and so is an absolute gift to QUAKE lovers and masochists alike. More challenging enemies, such as the brutal Scorpian robots and the weapon stealing Gremlins, combined with a handful of new and interesting weapons, like Mjolnir (That's Thor's hammer!) and a Prox-Mine gun, this mission pack injects new elements into a game that you may think you have mastered.  The long levels are a true test of the player's ability, especially on the Hard and Nightmare difficulties. If you are wanting to brave them, be ready for attrition against a rabbling horde of 180 enemies a level that are ALL more deadly than you.  It'll leave you sweating and battered, but no game is quite as rewarding when finished as QUAKE: Scourge of Armagon.  Recommended for Quake veterans and/ or people who want a challenge!

Just as intense (but much shorter) as the first Quake. Fans of Quake II will probably like this one because a large chunk of it takes place on a military base. The new enemies are really good, and the new weapons are fun to use as well. I enjoyed the last boss being more of a shoot-him-up scenario than the showdown with Shub in Q1. Level designs are a little more clever and innovative than the first Quake.

This is the first expansion for Quake 1: and it's excellent. If you liked Quake 1, you absolutely MUST buy this. The level design (by Levelord, who is brilliant), enemies and weapons greatly enhance the Quake formula.
